Audio Description: A stark black and white photograph of a large group of men and women in front of a bonfire is at the center of this poster about censorship. Most of the people in the crowd have their right arm raised in a Nazi salute. In front of the crowd are three men in military uniforms. The man at the left is wearing a long, belted coat and helmet with a chinstrap. The man in the center wears a light shirt, dark tie, dark pants tucked into knee-high leather boots, and a dark brimmed cap. The man on the right is wearing a dark jacket and pants, and a light color brimmed cap. On his left arm is a band with a swastika. In white letters on a black band above the picture are the words “Ten years ago”, and in large red block letters “The Nazis burned these books.” In a red band below the picture, in white letters, are the words “…but free Americans can still read them.”
Creator: United States. Office of War Information

Title: Ten years ago the Nazis burned these books: but free Americans can still read them
